column4: hi al.. i'm a gentoo user, i want to use ubuntu. i have questions, how can i contorl & add/remove my initscripts, how can i change runlevels this scripts..
ubuntu doesn't really do the runlevel thing. IIRC runlevels 2-6 or something are identical
I'll admit though, I know virtually nothing about runlevels
you need to enable universe first
how do i do it?
sorry,  I wasn't in gnome atm
go to the System>Administration>Syanaptic Package Manager
oh, you don't want to use synaptic from console
if you've set a root password you need to use su, not sudo
you need to edit the file /etc/apt/sources.list, there are two lines that are commented out, it tells you which lines to uncomment
something like 'su nano /etc/apt/sources.list' would work
ok, then as root run apt-get update
sudo uses your user password, su uses the root password
you probably just need to run 'apt-get upgrade'
i tried this "libid3tag"
you're sure you've enabled universe? apt-get update had no problems?
you've disabled main man =), you've got to get rid of those #'s
leave the lines with hoary-updates commented though
synaptic will allow you to search and select those packages quickly
apt is a really great package management tool, you'll get the hang of it in no time
yes i know, i used in suse so many times ago..
ah, I see
